item.title: 欧洲央行行长吉多斯称利率水平恰当，不确定性极高
item.description: 欧洲央行副行长路易斯·德·金多斯表示，当前利率处于合理水平，但他警告称地缘政治事件正带来"巨大不确定性"。【原文：European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said interest rates are at an appropriate level, though he warned of “enormous uncertainty” due to geopolitical events.】

item.title: 高盛预计美国消费者将推动2026年股市更广泛上涨
item.description: 华尔街的策略师们正寻求新的增长引擎来推动美国股市的牛市，因为市场对人工智能板块放缓的担忧日益加剧。【原文：Strategists across Wall Street are looking for new engines to power the bull market in American stocks, amid concerns about a slowdown in the artificial intelligence trade.】

item.title: 英国企业价格与薪资预期小幅回落，为英国央行注入动力
item.description: 英国企业预计未来12个月将略微降低员工薪资涨幅，同时小幅上调商品价格。这对仍对高通胀预期保持警惕的英国央行官员而言，无疑是个积极信号。【原文：UK businesses expect to hand workers slightly smaller pay rises and hike prices by less over the next 12 months, an encouraging sign for Bank of England officials who remain wary over elevated expectations.】

item.title: 2025年最佳股票交易持续走强，问题在于能持续多久
item.description: 2025年股市最火热的板块在新的一年依然炙手可热，但这股势不可挡的涨势让部分华尔街专业人士开始质疑：是否即将迎来反转？【原文：The hottest corner of the stock market in 2025 remains scorching in the new year, but the relentless momentum has some Wall Street pros wondering if a reversal is coming.】

item.title: 惨淡圣诞季令英国零售业雪上加霜
item.description: 英国三大零售商在圣诞季遭遇严峻挑战，消费者需求波动剧烈，价格竞争异常激烈。【原文：Three of Britain’s biggest retailers faced a tough Christmas marked by volatile consumer demand and intense price competition.】

item.title: 马来西亚在关键党内会议前撤销副总理贪腐案
item.description: 马来西亚总检察长办公室表示，将不再对副总理阿末扎希的贪污案采取进一步行动，理由是缺乏足够证据对其提起公诉。【原文：Malaysia’s Attorney General’s Chambers said it would take no further action against Deputy Prime Minister Ahmad Zahid Hamidi in relation to his graft case, citing insufficient evidence to prosecute him.】

item.title: 新加坡星展银行为重大风险转移奠定基础
item.description: 星展集团控股有限公司正考虑进军重大风险转移市场，随着贷款机构越来越多地转向此类交易以推动增长和吸收冲击。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd. is weighing a foray into the market for significant risk transfers as lenders increasingly turn to such deals as a way to drive growth and absorb shocks.】

item.title: 汇丰银行同意支付3亿欧元以了结法国税务分红调查
item.description: HSBC Holdings Plc has agreed to pay about €300 million ($350 million) to settle a twin criminal and tax case in France into its alleged role in the “Cum-Cum” scandal that’s embroiled some of the biggest banks in the country.

item.title: 法国农民开着拖拉机前往巴黎抗议自由贸易协定
item.description: 法国农民驾驶数十辆拖拉机开赴埃菲尔铁塔等巴黎地标，向政府施压要求其不要支持欧盟与南美国家达成的自由贸易协定。【原文：French farmers drove dozens of tractors to the Eiffel Tower and other Parisian landmarks to pressure the government not to support a European Union free-trade deal with South American nations.】

item.title: 欧洲人工智能竞赛点燃数据中心支持债券市场
item.description: 随着欧洲地区努力在人工智能产业蓬勃发展的浪潮中迎头赶上美国，今年将有一系列由欧洲数据中心支持的债务交易陆续进入市场。【原文：A spate of debt deals backed by European data centers is set to come to market this year as the region strives to catch up with the US in the race to capitalize on the booming artificial intelligence industry.】

item.title: 2025年因担忧特朗普政策，外国投资者争相抢购日本股票
item.description: Foreign investors flocked to Japanese equities last year, purchasing the most since 2013 as they sought refuge from US economic uncertainty under President Donald Trump.

item.title: 摩根大通的买入建议引发南非食品生产商股价上涨
item.description: 南非食品生产商股价攀升至近八年高点，此前摩根大通公司建议买入该类股票，理由是其前景强劲。【原文：South African food producers climbed to an almost eight-year high after JPMorgan Chase & Co. recommended buying the stock, citing robust prospects.】

item.title: 意大利2026年首轮国债拍卖吸引1900亿欧元认购
item.description: 意大利正通过发行两期欧元债券启动其2026年融资计划，借势欧洲其他地区政治不确定性重塑资金流向之际，投资者对其债务的强劲需求。【原文：Italy is kicking off its 2026 funding program with a dual-tranche euro bond sale, capitalizing on strong investor demand for its debt as political uncertainty elsewhere in Europe reshapes flows.】

item.title: 埃尼诺尔签署价值100亿美元协议以维持挪威产量
item.description: 挪威国家石油公司（Equinor ASA）签署了价值约1000亿挪威克朗（合99亿美元）的合同，以确保其在挪威的石油和天然气产量至少在未来十年内维持当前水平。【原文：Equinor ASA signed contracts worth about 100 billion kroner ($9.9 billion) to help maintain its current oil and gas output in Norway for at least another decade.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉1700亿美元债务乱局可能面临的局面
item.description:
传奇律师李·布赫海特谈潜在主权债务重组

【原文：

Legendary lawyer Lee Buchheit on a potential sovereign debt restructuring.

】

item.title: 零散股：委内瑞拉债务重组的可能性（播客）
item.description: 零散股：委内瑞拉债务重组的可能性（播客）【原文：Odd Lots: A Potential Venezuelan Debt Restructuring (Podcast)】

item.title: 南非工厂情绪跌至六年最低点
item.description: 南非制造业者信心指数在12月跌至近六年低点，受国内需求疲软及就业增长担忧影响，进一步恶化至收缩区间。【原文：South African manufacturers’ sentiment soured to a near six-year low in December, deteriorating further into contraction territory amid sluggish domestic demand and concerns about job growth.】

item.title: 欧洲央行称消费者通胀预期保持不变
item.description: 欧元区消费者通胀预期在11月保持稳定，这为欧洲央行维持利率不变的计划提供了支撑。【原文：Inflation expectations among euro-area consumers were stable in November, supporting the European Central Bank’s plan to keep interest rates on hold.】

item.title: SNB Shifted Stance on Rate Toward Neither Cutting Nor Hiking
item.description: 瑞士国家银行上月决定维持利率不变，这既未降息也未加息，堪称双向决策，似乎标志着政策倾向的转变。【原文：The Swiss National Bank’s decision last month to keep interest rates steady was a two-way call neither to cut them nor to raise them in what appears to be a shift in bias.】

item.title: 亿万富翁卡斯特啤酒帝国继承人罢免CEO未果
item.description: 欧洲最富有的饮料家族之一，其两名继承人在试图罢免家族同名企业卡斯特集团（Castel Group）最高管理层的斗争中，首轮交锋告负。【原文：Two heirs to one of Europe’s richest drinks families lost the first round in their battle to oust the top executive of their family’s eponymous firm, Castel Group.】

item.title: 沙特基础工业公司因计划通过出售欧洲和美国资产进行缩编而股价暴跌
item.description: 沙特基础工业公司（Sabic）在利雅得股市跌至16年低点，此前该公司通过出售欧美资产缩减了业务规模。【原文：Sabic sank to a 16-year low in Riyadh trading after shrinking its business by selling assets in Europe and the US.】

item.title: 据称贝莱德与政府投资公司认购MiniMax 6.19亿美元香港IPO股份
item.description: 知情人士透露，投资公司贝莱德（Baillie Gifford）和新加坡主权财富基金GIC Pte等机构正认购MiniMax集团备受期待的48亿港元（6.19亿美元）香港首次公开募股（IPO）股份。【原文：Investment firm Baillie Gifford and Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund GIC Pte are among those buying shares in MiniMax Group Inc.’s much-awaited HK$4.8 billion ($619 million) initial public offering in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 人工智能支出热潮推动可转换债券交易量创24年来新高
item.description: 全球企业正以24年来最快的速度发行可转换债券，人工智能的发展正推动企业寻求更低成本的融资渠道。【原文：Companies around the world are issuing convertible bonds at the fastest pace in 24 years, as the development of artificial intelligence spurs a hunt for cheaper financing.】

item.title: 欧洲天然气与电力交易即将实现全天候交易
item.description: 欧洲电力和天然气市场即将迎来重大改革，计划延长交易时间并使其与全球其他大宗商品市场接轨。【原文：European power and natural gas markets are set to undergo a major overhaul amid plans to extend trading hours and align them with other global commodities.】

item.title: 中国承诺日本民用贸易不受最新限制措施影响
item.description: 中国试图向日本企业保证，其最新的出口管制措施具有明确的针对性，并表示旨在限制军事应用的管制措施不会影响民用用途。【原文：China sought to reassure Japanese businesses that its latest export controls are narrowly targeted, saying that civilian use will remain unaffected by curbs intended to limit military applications.】

item.title: 玛莎百货加速实施转型计划以助其从网络攻击中恢复
item.description: 玛莎百货公司表示正加速实施转型计划，并维持盈利预期不变。这家英国零售商正努力从去年四月的网络攻击中恢复元气。【原文：Marks & Spencer Plc said it is accelerating its turnaround plan and maintained its profit guidance as the British retailer seeks to recover from last April’s cyberattack.】

item.title: 泰国黄金交易商计划推行美元计价交易以抑制泰铢升值
item.description: 泰国最大黄金交易商计划推广美元计价交易，旨在削弱黄金对本国货币的影响力，并规避惩罚性税收的威胁。【原文：Thailand’s largest gold traders plan to promote dollar-denominated transactions, aiming to weaken the metal’s influence on the local currency and head off the threat of a punitive tax.】

item.title: 美国宇航局考虑因医疗紧急情况提前结束太空任务
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局正考虑提前结束国际空间站上的一项任务，此前一名宇航员突发医疗紧急状况。【原文：NASA is considering ending a mission on board the International Space Station early after an astronaut suffered a medical emergency.】

item.title: AB食品公司警告称，因Primark业绩疲软及食品销售下滑，公司利润将受影响
item.description: 联合英国食品公司警告称，受Primark销售疲软及食品业务表现参差不齐的影响，本财年利润将低于预期。【原文：Associated British Foods Plc warned that profit will be lower than expected this fiscal year, hit by weaker Primark sales and a mixed performance in its food business.】

item.title: 瑞士通胀率时隔五个月首次回升
item.description: 瑞士通胀率上月出现自7月以来的首次上升，缓解了瑞士国家银行重新实施负利率的压力。【原文：Swiss inflation ticked up last month for the first time since July, easing pressure on the Swiss National Bank to reintroduce negative interest rates.】
